newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: New Amsterdam-Tallin-Riga air cargo link opened.
newsitem.headline: New Amsterdam-Tallin-Riga air cargo link opened.

text.p: Air Baltic and Estonian Air have concluded an interline agreement facililitating through Amsterdam-Tallin-Riga cargo movement, said its Benelux general sales agent, Air Support.

Carlo de Haas, cargo sales manager of Air Support, which instigated the interline arrangement, said Estonian operated daily Amsterdam Schiphol-Tallinn flights with Boeing 737-500 aircraft, which can uplift 2.5 tonnes of cargo.
He added it was now possible to transfer shipments on these flights to onward Tallin-Riga Air Baltic services, flown six times a week with a British Aerospace RJ70 or a Saab 340.
Air Baltic can carry a maximum of three tonnes of cargo a week on these aircraft from Tallinn to Riga.
Another of Air Support's clients, Croatia Airlines, is operating additional flights under its new summer schedule, noted De Haas.
In addition to five weekly Schiphol-Zagreb services, an extra flight to Split operates on Saturdays. The airline's Sunday flight to Zagreb also now operates via Pula, Croatia.
De Haas added that Yemen Airways has replaced a 1.5- to two tonne-capacity Boeing 727-200 with an Airbus 310-300, capable of uplifting 15 tonnes, under its new summer schedule.
Yemen Airways is an offline carrier in the Netherlands.
The service operates twice a week between Sanaa and Frankfurt. Rutges operates trucking services between Amsterdam and Frankfurt.

De Haas said that additionally, Air Support will in the future carry out airport-to-door delivery on behalf of three of its client -- Lithuanian Airlines, Estonian Air and Meridiana -- following demand from shippers.
